reviewText: The kindest comment I can make about this movie is that it is an introduction into the life of Hildegard of Bingen.  I'm assuming that they did not want to get into specifics about the controversies of her visions.  Do you really think that she was threatened with excommunication over an argument about a novice?If this story piqued your interest into the life of Hildegard, I implore you to read an unedited biography - not published by the church - of her amazing life and visions.  There are editions that include her own sketches of her visions, which will make it easier for you to understand why she and her intercessors needed to describe her spiritual love for God, taking the form of human love...I'm just confusing the issue.  Hildegard was a true visionary who's only weakness was that she was human - if that is really a weakness.  I urge you to read more about this Saintly Woman.

reviewText: I had read a biography of St Hildegard, and was impressed with her dignity and holiness. She composed many songs of the Church, centuries ago. This film paid great homage to her. See it. It's lovely.
summary: A Great Saint and Doctor of the Catholic Church

reviewText: This far exceeded my expectations. I was so surprised and delighted with the depiction of the revelations. Such great acting by all, conveying dignity, piety, and devotion to God. I loved hearing all the Bible quotations. Thank you to all who brought this project to life!

reviewText: I have loved every movie and tv and sketch that has had Patricia Routledge in it.  She is one of the most talented actresses ever...The movie Hildegard was a little confusing to me because I had never heard the history of the storyline before, and I think the makers of the film left out a lot of information that they probably assumed people would already know (I know they always have to have some things end up on the cutting room floor, but it seemed there were large gaps in the story that just didn't make sense)...Overall, it was well made, but I suggest reading the full story of Hildegard before watching this movie.  Otherwise, you might be "lost" as I was in some scenes...

reviewText: Although the film was a subject of interest, I found it lacking and will look for another.  Visions were represented with an odd viewing approach; no real expected depth to the story; and left me wondering.  I will order films from this firm again; they were speedy, efficient and had the film in record time - Many Thanks.
